meanings.definition: The act of closing and opening the eyelids quickly.
meanings.sent1: In an eyeblink, the cat caught the mouse.
meanings.sent2: She missed the movie's ending in an eyeblink.
meanings.sent3: The magician made the rabbit disappear in an eyeblink.
meanings.sent4: Time flew by in an eyeblink during the fun party.
meanings.sent5: The car sped past in an eyeblink, leaving dust in the air.

meanings.definition: A very short period of time.
meanings.sent1: He finished the race in an eyeblink.
meanings.sent2: The sun set in an eyeblink, signaling the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream melted in an eyeblink under the hot sun.
meanings.sent4: The news spread like wildfire in an eyeblink.
meanings.sent5: The storm passed through in an eyeblink, leaving a rainbow behind.
